32398257.review:
Teleportation is among the largest complaints in room-scale VR gaming. 
Smashbox Arena utilizes teleportation in a way that adds depth to the gameplay. An animated teleport must be tossed to a desired teleport location. Once it lands on a flat surface (it will bounce off of non-flat surfaces), a short animation takes place before teleporting the player.
A player can cancel their teleport at anytime once it is thrown, and enemy players can cancel each other's teleporters. Many strategies have developed between players using the teleport disc alone. Faking out with teleporters, distracting before shooting, and teleporting onto moving objects.

After 300 hours of play time it is safe to say Smashbox Arena is by far the best VR experience I have had since purchasing my Vive. The community surrounding this game is one of the most welcoming I've ever experienced. 

Having taken part in multiple community held tournaments and leagues it's safe to say competitive multiplayer VR is here, and Smashbox is the definition of a VR eSport.

At first glance the gameplay of Smashbox Arena is quite simple. Pick up and shoot balls, teleport around, and knock out the opposing team in 3v3 fights. This simplicity makes Smashbox easy to pick up for new VR players, and highly acessible for venues like VR Arcades.

The gameplay contains an added depth thanks to its reliance on room-scale VR. Players can, and must, dodge, lean, crouch, and utilize all 360 degrees in order to master the game.

If you have a room-scale VR set up give the Smashbox Arena demo a try. It is the full game but limited to a single map. Players who have purchased the game can jump into the demo game along side you. 

Check out the guides and discussion boards for tips on how to handle yourself in game, as there is a bit of a skill curve between new and veteran players. If you'd like someone to help you out feel free to send me a friend request here on steam.

There are full games being player every day in Smashbox Arena, and it is quite popular at multiple VR Arcades.

This game is soooo much more fun than I would have expected. After playing something similar in Rec Room, the level of polish they put into this game is very rewarding. What they've done in Rec Room is amazing, but they have so much more to focus on. If you liked the paintball in Rec Room, you will be blown away by this.

Positives:
- Mic enabled chat
- Simple concept executed well
- Intuitive controls
- After you're out, you can see the players on the map (great to fill the time while you wait)
- Excellent tutorial

Cons:
- I don't think enough people know about this game yet, servers should be full (marketing may need an overhaul)

Neutral:
- Whimsical graphics

I'm very excited to see where they go with this game. It goes right up there with Audioshield and Space Pirate trainer for more fun than conceptually imagined, and a need-to-show for everyone new to VR.

Thank you Devs, #following #supporting

[h1]Where did everyone go?[/h1]

Many of these reviews are months old. Here is my experience in the past 3 or 4 months:

Development has come to a standstill (for whatever reason is besides the point, I am reviewing this as a customer). There are still the same old issues that have always existed in this game. The AI bots are still very unbalanced, they can still teleport through walls. Compared to when I first started playing this game, online is pretty much dead. There are still a couple of weird bugs here and there, for example the game keeps freezing if I try to exit out of it.

Graphics and gameplay were otherwise great - very fun, enganging, and unique among all the other VR shooters. This game should have been a big hit but unfortunately seems to be dying. If there were more people online, I'd probably recommend it again.

3対3のチームに分かれて戦うドッジボール。
地面に落ちているアイテム（ボール、巨大な岩、炎、追尾ミサイルなど）を拾って敵にぶつけて全員倒すと勝利です。
ルールはシンプルですがこれは面白い。

一度ボールに当たったプレイヤーは、俯瞰モードで観戦が可能。
試合時間が長くなると、敵を皆殺しにするミサイルがステージに現れるので、
芋プレイでダラダラと試合時間が長くなることはありません。

ゲーム内の移動方法は、移動先に球を飛ばして一定時間後に移動する方式ですが、
移動先が相手にも見えるので、下手な場所に移動すると狙い撃ちにされてしまいます。
テレポートのバランスがよく調整されていてGood。

シングルモード、フレンドマッチも一通り用意されていて、
プレイヤーもそれなりの数がいるようなので、自信をもってオススメします。

Best multiplayer VR experience I've had so far.  Rounds are quick and downtime is minimal.  The controls are easy to pick up for beginners and the gameplay has enough depth to keep you coming back to improve your skills.  I've spent more hours on this game than any other VR game to date.

The developers and support team are excellent and are often playing the game with public players as well.  Recently the game stopped working for me (I had the windows 7 issue that has now been patched).  I emailed support and received a response an hour later.  Over the next 24 hours I had over 20 messages back and forth with a developer who had many fixes to try and even created several special beta-builds of the game for me to test in an attempt to fix my issues.  It turned out the issue wasn't even specific to this game and was happening to me with multiple VR games, but the developer persisted and helped me solve the issue for all the games I was unable to play, not just Smashbox.  Outstanding support!  I was back in Smashbox Arena the evening after I reported the issue and the Win7 fix was made public shortly thereafter.  Thanks Gabe!

Let me get this out of the way, I fucking HATE teleportation and try not to buy games that only have it as an option. This game however, was able to sell me. It just works. It makes you plan your moves and think fast due to the pace of the game.
 
 I got the demo a couple weeks ago with intentions of using it to demo to friends, played it a decent amount but wasn't sold on buying it. I joined the game the other day to take a break from my other go to game (Onward) and was met in the lobby by an entire group of people. We spent 5 mins or so shooting dodge balls at each other and they answered some questions I had before heading off as a group to a game. 

 It took me a few minutes to decide to buy it after they left. I ended up in the same game with them and had a blast! So much fun! I met a dev in the game today (The dev obv cared about the game hearing him talk). All in all the people I have met have all been cool and have made for some really good times. When you get into a tense match it well have you moving, crouching and dodging. I'm talking busier than a monkey with 3 d!cks.

I recomend this game to anyone willing to give it a try. If you are on the fence get the demmo and keep in mind there are other maps and you will have more interaction with real players with the full game.

TL;DR 
Get the demo, love it, buy it and play it.

28761977.review:
I recieved this game for free from the developers to help test Oculus Touch. If you're using Touch, you can buy this game without fear of incompatibility. Ok, with that out of the way:

THIS. FRIGGIN. GAME.

It's dodgeball. In VR. With dodgeball guns. It's a blast, and super simple to learn, pick up, and get going.

The guns will suck up balls from the ground. One ball per gun at a time, and while you can teleport from either hand, the hand has to be empty. This leads to a wonderful balance between being "loaded" with 2 shots, and mobility. You can defend yourself with a ball, or you can catch incoming balls if you have good timing. As I said, very simple, but amazingly compelling. When you get hit and are "out" you can view the current level and all players in diorama scale, and it's really freaking cool.

$30 might be a little much for an asking price, but it's a lot of fun, and easily something you'll demo to VR newbies. If you see it on sale, it's an effortless reccomendation. If you're on the fence, there's a demo available. You'll definitely get your money's worth though, as the replayability is high with this one.

28732412.review:
This game is going to quickly rise to the top of the VR multiplayer genre.
The experience is supremely polished from the ground up, providing everything desired from a newcomer to a seasoned gaming veteran.

The game mechanics are simple to grasp, easy to implement and yet offer enough variety for some serious strategizing.
The environments are diverse and charismatic in their own right and keep each match fresh.

The character models are fantastic and the AI seems able to keep up with even the best players.
Voice chat is flawless, and the "God View" when eliminated - the best possible solution to keep destroyed players busy while the match concludes.

The Tie-Breaker Missile delivers at the perfect moment, keeping the action at a steady and desirable pace.

The only element we could ask for in a future update would be the ability to host private matches.  Otherwise, this game is a masterpiece!

28674453.review: This game is too much fun.  Like others have stated, if you enjoy paintball from Rec Room, chances are high that you'll enjoy Smashbox Arena so much more.  The controls are nearly perfect and I love that you can choose where the teleport but it gives you a window of about one and a half seconds to cancel that decision by holding the teleport button down and aiming elsewhere.  The matches are often quick because the areans are small but that's a good thing.  Maybe it's due to the fact that it's Christmas but evertime I've been online, I've seen 3 people playing, at most.  I know there's gotta be way more people playing online than that!  I like that you can customize your avatar with different heads but it's kinda messed up they have white people, robots, skunks (?), and then orcs lmao...I'm light-skinned so I wish there was a way to simply choose a skin shade and change hair.  Maybe in an update.  I don't normally complain about that sort of thing, I usually honestly don't care.  But I have felt different about that in VR games where I'm literally in the game representing myself.  As far as gameplay, you can't go wrong with Smashbox Arena.  Hopefully the community grows to the point where we can have lobbies that allow us to make matches and choose which arena to play in.

This game is the rich man's version of paintball in Rec Room. I'm actually not a huge fan of paintball, but it works well as a 4v4 party VR game.

This is 3v3, and it is so much better. The shooting is fluid, the arenas are well made, there is AI that fills in any gaps in your team and the AI is pretty solid without being overly challenging. The mechanics are well done - there are powerups that drop throughout the map at various intervals. Movement is by delayed teleport, which works well.

The few things I'd fault about the game are nitpicks, and the devs could fix them easily. The voice in the lobby doesn't need to give instructions every 30 seconds (especially while you wait for your friends to join) and the change region area shouldn't require 4 teleports if you're not in the US. That's pretty much it - everything else about this game is absolutely golden.

I bought this on sale, but it's worth full price.

28426750.review:
I was lucky enough to win a free key for this on a reddit thread, and it has since become my most played VR game.

This game is an absolute blast. Dodgeball on big multi-tiered maps, crazy powerups, blocking and catching, a good sized playerbase on the servers, and a solid one player mode with progessively harder AI. For me, it strikes a nearly perfect balance in tone and accessibility; not as serious and "hardcore" as Onward, but not as simplistic and repetetive as Rec Room's paintball. The game is very easy to pick up, but there's a suprising ammount of depth for you to dig into, and tactics to pick up as you go.

The locomotion is teleport, but handled in a way that really creates good gameplay; you shoot your teleporter, which can bounce off walls, and there is brief moment where it lights up before you appear there. This important for two reasons: 1, the enemy can see where you're going to be and set up their aim and 2) you now have a brief moment to grab another weapon (you'd need 1 hand free to fire your teleport) and get the optimal aim/position.

There's often an advantageous "high ground" position to fight over, there's a intense sudden death missle to race to, there's a crazy Indiana Jones style boulder to unleash on your foes, and the God-view spectator mode when you die is simply genius (seriously, every multiplayer VR game needs to copy this).

It's also, for a beta, quite well polished. The menu has you taking "shuttles" to the different game modes, the AI is quite competent (and kicks my ass at medium difficulty) and the training mode is the perfect intro for new players.

As a beta, there's still a couple bugs that pop up from time to time, and it's a little odd have two totally different announer voices, but that's really all I can find to nitpick. This game is great, and you owe it to yourself to give it a try.

The bots are good, and the game includes both a tutorial and a short single player 'story' mode, so if you want to get up to speed before playing against real people, you can. I'd recommend just doing the tutorial, though, and jumping straight into multiplayer. That's where it's at.

画面质量 ：4星
游戏可玩性：5星
游戏眩晕优化：5星
国际联机优化：3星

游戏上手非常容易，总体的模式就是捡起各种武器，扔向对手，消灭对手。能捡起来的武器挺多，有普通的球，重力球，导弹，手榴弹，火弹，和狙击枪。一个手捡球，另一个手完成瞬移（如果两个手都是武器，那么就无法瞬移了）。游戏中的瞬移设置得非常巧妙，瞬移完成之后会停留2秒，防止无限瞬移而导致无法被击中的局面。
游戏分为故事模式和多人联机模式。故事模式其实就是和AI玩3对3的游戏，会随着游戏的进程更换地图并增加AI的难度。单机玩也挺有趣，但多人联机才是这个游戏的精髓。你要和团队制定战术，要占据有利地形，要争夺稀有武器资源。和朋友玩起来真的是不亦乐乎。不过对于国内玩家来说最悲剧的一点就是延迟稍高，我的机器大概有400毫秒的延迟，会一定程度上影响到游戏体验，所以如果能国内联机那是最好的。

28395166.review:
An okay game - especially if you like the paintball game in rec room. This essentially is paintball from rec room with a few more bells and whistles (power ups, better teleport mechanic, ability to block/catch incoming balls) and some polish on top. I bought this game after seeing the highly positive reviews here on steam and praise for it on the vive subreddit.

I played about ten multiplayer games and I realized the game wasn't a hit for me.  There were several problems which  stood out to me:

1. As someone playing from Europe, I had to play on the US East region since that's the default region and no one switched to the European one. Perhaps some way to automatically set the best default region would be better? As a result I had some pretty noticeable lag  with a ping varying from 110 to 160. The game felt floaty at times. This is especially noticeable when dying - I would get hit, and after a blink of eye I was dead, still giving me some time to react before the game actually said I was dead.

2. Maybe this is also a problem only when playing from Europe - I played the game on a Thursday since my schedule only lets me game on weekdays - but of the ten games I played, only two didn't have two or more bots. Now I'm not against the bots in this game (they're okay - like rocket league bots they sort of just stand  around and sometimes randomly do something good), and it's a good idea to fill up to a 3 v 3 - but it still kind of sucks to play with/against bots. On top of that, somehow the bots were poorly distributed in one of the matches I played. It was a 3 players vs 1 player and 2 bots match - that was a really unfair + not fun match.

3. I personally dislike the teleport mechanism in shooting or shooting-like games in general. Smashbox Arena does improve on the mechanic by letting people see where another person is going to teleport to before it actually happens. This does not, however, prevent people from sneaking up behind you far  quicker than it would normally be possible, which makes cover far less valuable. This certainly makes the game more action heavy and fast-paced, but for my tastes it was too chaotic.

However, if you like the paint ball game in rec room and you're playing from North America - then this game should be right up your alley. If you're like me and were disappointed from the paintball in rec room, then this game won't be the best thing since Budget Cuts/The Lab/Onward, especially not for the price tag of 23/27 Euros.

28366997.review:
A fantastic and satisfying VR experience.

Of all the VR titles I've played, this one is definitely among the best.
It's one of the few out there that truly has a "finished" feel to it.
Sure, there's room for improvement but Smashbox Arena is an amazing step in the right direction for VR multiplayer games.

Pros:

- Hillarious and fun gameplay. I found myself booting it up for the first time to just give it a quick try and see what all the hype was about... Fast forward 4 hours and I'm still having a blast at 4:34am.

- The story mode. I think the story mode is a fantastic way to introduce players into the game! The difficulties scale decently well and allow players to get a feel for the game before jumping into multiplayer! It could have a bit more added to it as far as content goes, but seeing as how the primary focus of this game is it's multiplayer aspect, it's really easy to overlook.

- Great community. I guess this really speaks for the whole VR community in general, but I've met some of the nicest people in this game. Hardly any toxicity!

Cons:

- Matchmaking. Just like any multiplayer game, there will be multitudes of different skill levels amongst players. This game does have a sort of ranking system where players can earn badges, but there isn't any sort of filtering along with that.. For example if three veterans join a game with 3 newbies, the veterans could end up all on the same team resulting in an incredibly unbalanced game.

- Bugs. There are bound to be bugs in nearly any VR game. That's just a given. Even so, there's one particular bug that I've seen multiple times now in which players are able to reach through walls. For example if I'm standing on one side of a wall and you're standing on the other, I can reach my gun forward and stick it through the wall in some cases and shoot you. Not necesarily game breaking, but a definite annoyance.

- Bots. The bots in this game, even on their hardest difficulty, aren't much of a challenge. I was able to breeze through all three difficulties in story mode fairly easily. I think some improvements to map awareness for the bots would do wonders as there are times where they get stuck trying to teleport to the same spot over and over. Another thing is that they don't turn in your direction when firing. So if the bot is looking and pointing it's gun to the right, and I'm to it's left, the ball will shoot sideways out of it's gun and hit. This isn't too big of a deal once you get used to it but it can be a bit annoying when a bot is turned one way, making you believe his focus is elsewhere, and then suddenly a ball comes flying towards your face.

- Hitbox. The hitboxes in this game can be a bit inconsistent at times. For the most part it's not a problem but there has been a time or two where I've deflected a ball directly away from me but it still registers as a hit. I debated even adding this to cons because of how rarely it happend, but it *did* happen so I figured I should at least say something.


The verdict: BUY IT! Smashbox Arena is definitely one you don't want to miss out on. It's multiplayer experience is unrivaled and it packs endless hours of multiplayer entertainment.

28346068.review: This really is a fantastic game and in my opinion, the best multiplayer experience that can be had on the Vive at present. The developers clearly put thought into it's design and there are lots of little touches frequently missed by many indie titles.  For example, the intro sequence to each match, the confetti guns on the podiums, the detailed spectator mode in the lobby etc. It all blends together to make the experience more enjoyable. There is a well thought out tutorial introducing all the game's mechanics, make this game very easy to pick-up and play for newcomers. The playerbase is sound and I never have issues finding a match. When a player does leave, a bot seamlessly transitions in until someone else joins which usually doesn't take too long. The game mechanics are tuned and very effective, with well thought-out power-ups adding to the fun. The community is friendly and very forgiving to newcomers, everyone is just having fun. This has become my go-to game to pick-up and play at least a few matches. The closest MP competitor for me was Rec Room which I also highly recommend. I hope this sets a new standard for indie titles, and proves you don't need big budgets to polish a game.

28338354.review:
Really fun game. Considering the current state of VR I think this is an excellent example of how to do deathmatch games right. 

The cooldowns mean that there is moments where you are a threat and moments where you are vulnerable. This means you should try to be effective with whatever ability you are using and not waste it because if you miss then you are vulnerable until you re-arm yourself.

The mechanics (where you must arm yourself for each attack) sets the game for skill based fights where it comes down to who can can be the most effective per opportunity.

Smashbox Arena makes it very easy to understand the gameplay, levels and weapons. The single player matches are very good for training and the AI are just right for difficulty. Actually during single player I was wondering if some of the AI were real people because of the voices.

VR as an industry has a long way to go but hands down this is the best VR Team combat sport/game for 2016 and the game is most likely going to only get better with future updates.

I definitely recommend this game for people that want to have some immersive VR fun and some mild cardio exercise.


Things to keep an eye on:
- Make sure your play area is clean because once you are in combat you will quickly forget about any objects you have put in your play area.

- Because you will be turning a lot, make sure you untangle/unbunch your cable after X amount of time because without realising it you will turn a lot in this game.

For a VR Team combat experience I rate this game: 10/10.

This is WAY more fun than I had anticipated. Its 1AM EST on a Monday morning here. I just finished playing more than a few rounds.


Pros:
-Teleportation DONE RIGHT. There is a channeling period when you teleport, and the spot you're teleporting to lights up with your team's color. I'm usually a fan of trackpad locomotion, but the teleporting works out great.

-Seemingly no latency issues so far.

-The community is great as of now.

-The lobby system is really well done. There's a central area where everyone spawns, and then there are shuttles you can all jump on to either start or join an existing game.

-I've played a lot of VR titles where I ended up getting bored after about an hour and never looking back. This is a game that I'm sure I'll revisit frequently. I'm definitely playing more tomorrow.

-As of right now... this is a multiplayer game with people online actually playing! Everyone I've encountered has agreed that this game is most likely here to stay for a while.


Neutral:

-There are about 5 or 6 maps right now. I'm sure with popularity that more could be added.


Cons:

-Lack of ingame options

-I really can't think of much else. I think I encountered a glitch where someone's name didn't show up once.


Overall, this is a must have for the Vive if you've been looking for a fun multiplayer experience. I'm dying to play more right now, but this game is almost impossible to play quietly. You can pull off some really cool maneuvers that are hard not to exclaim at.

28319099.review:
Easily one of the best games I've played on the Vive (and I've tried over 30 VR titles). Multiplayer is an absolute blast and the game's fundamental mechanics are really solid. There's lots of strategy and skill in how you aim your teleports, take cover, account for ball flight and bounce when you aim, and use deflections and catches to protect yourself. For those that prefer trackpad-based motion, rest assured that this game is still worth it. I generally prefer trackpad myself, but the mechanics in this game work perfectly for its style of play

Multiplayer features 3x3 gameplay, with bots that are automatically rotated in and out of teams to keep things balanced. You're eliminated by a single hit, and each team scores a point when they've knocked out all of the opposing members. First to five wins. When you're knocked out, you see a live map overview that can be rotated and zoomed - and best of all, can continue to shout out encouragement (and warnings) to your teammates. Since rounds finish quickly, you're never waiting to play again for more than a minute. 

I was impressed by the variety of maps available at launch - and how they encourage a mix of close-quarter and larger-scale gameplay. The power-ups also add some fun unpredictableness to matches, although a few of them feel a bit nerfed (the homing missile is way too slow, for example). Graphics are clean and smooth. I have had zero technical glitches during gameplay so far.

Kudos for the developers for delivering such a polished and fun game!

28303864.review:
Great game that definitely has a lot of potential. The price seems perfectly fair to me for a game with this high of replay value - I have 2 HTC Vives so after playing for < 10 minutes I had purchased a 2nd copy; this is probably the most fun I've had with the Vive in the ~7 months I have owned it. I set supersampling to 1.6 and it looks really clean while barely taxing 50% of my GTX 1080 so this is a game that will likely play well across a wide range of hardware.

Because of the way the game flows, I believe this is one of the better solutions to the "terminal mass" issue other multiplayer VR games suffer from. AI bots seamlessly pop in/out of matches to keep things interesting even when you don't have a full 6-player match going and I believe Smashbox Arena will quickly gain in popularity. The number of people I've already heard telling their wives/etc in the background, "just one more round!" only to stick around for another dozen rounds goes to show how addicting this game is.

I had no part in the beta/etc and heard about this game for the first time on Reddit 2 days ago. It's easy enough to pick up and play for pretty much anybody and it has a lot of unique elements that make it something special. The only thing I'd like to see (off the top of my head) are some additional game modes down the road such as Capture the Flag/etc (a la Splatoon on the Wii U - one of my all-time favorite games.)

If you're on the fence... I say go for it. Between my 2 Vives I have purchased over 100 VR titels (and multiple copies of a number of multiplayer games) and I think this is probably my best purchase yet. Get it while it's on sale so we can keep packing the matches and pushing this game to the heights it deserves. 

Great game.

28253524.review:
So I'm updating this review because I've now put almost 25 hours into this game.  Yes 25 hours.  In one week.  This more than anything else I can say is a testament to how good Smashbox arena is, but let me elaborate more anyway.

There are a lot of VR games that are "wow" experiences.  There are currently still very few "just one more game and it's 1AM" experiences.  Smashbox Arena is this kind of game.  

What makes this game work so well is simply the amount of careful design balance that has been applied to the level design and the power ups and the ways the different power ups play off one another.  There are a lot of subtlies and nuances to the mechanics that gradually become more apparent the more you play and the more you talk to other players.  It's an incredibly easy game to pick up and start having fun with, but it remains fun because it's so well design that winning and losing isn't just simply a matter of reflexes.  It is often a matter of strategy and at any given moment you have a plethora of options on how you approach a given scenario. 

I know a lot of VR players have become rightly cynical about half finished games, cash grabs, and over hyped experiences.  A lot of even the bigger titles (like Arizona Sunshine) wouldn't really hold up as non-VR games, but they are championed because hey at least there is some substance.  This game is not one of those games. This game is the Rocket League of VR games; it is a similar indie Cinderella story.  This isn't jsut my favorite VR game this year.  It may well be my favorite game this year period.

28253192.review:
好游戏，难怪价钱这么高，值这个价！

我现在对VR联机游戏既期待又担心，VR真的能创造很多有趣好玩的联机游戏，但是玩家不够分，跟不上游戏的产出速度。看到这个游戏，我是有兴趣的，考虑到定价这么高，玩家估计多不到哪去，原本打算放弃，看到支持单人模式，决定还是试一下，结果没有失望，单人模式不是鸡肋，不仅仅是用来等玩家的。

很多人讨厌在VR游戏里瞬移，但我一直认为瞬移不一定影响游戏性，也不影响沉浸感，只要和游戏搭配好就行。这游戏玩法比较特别，瞬移成了核心玩法之一，成了游戏乐趣的一部分，去掉瞬移就没那么好玩了。这里面的瞬移不是指哪就马上到哪，而是会掉一个东西（就叫它传送盘吧）在地上，掉完后不是马上就到那，可以反悔再丢，所以你甚至可以假丢，让对手以为你会瞬移到那，瞬移到时会闪烁光芒暴露自己。传送盘掉在不同的地方还可能会反弹，掉向哪里还有点策略。

散落在地上的球，有些是具有各种特效的，比如巨石、火球、炸弹等。大家一起争夺，吸到你的枪上，发射出去，射中后就死了，死了后你就上帝视角观战，游戏节奏很快，观战时间不会很长。对手发出球后，你反应快的话还能接过来再射过去，也可以发球把对方发过来的各种球踢回去。

球不是任意远都能吸到枪上，是有距离限制的，传送盘此时又可以发挥出作用了，你可以用传送盘踢球，球会滚动，这样可以让对手吸不到球或者传球给队友，甚至可以让球反弹给自己。队友如果占据有利位置，但是吸不到球，你也可以发球传过去。两个手拿球的话不能瞬移。

地图多，造型更多，玩单人模式能够解锁新造型，不只是换个皮肤，还有剧情和配音的，玩的过程中AI也会说话，结束后，站在领奖台，你的人物会发言，台下的对手不服气，也会说话挑衅你，充满了欢乐。有些造型是非人类，说的根本不是人类的语言。单人模式分三个难度，每一个难度是把所有地图赢一遍，完成一个难度才能解锁下一个难度。联机模式有AI顶替，不怕没人。

建议增加一个慢节奏的、少球、多时长的地图或模式，现在节奏太快（每回合一分钟），不能最大限度的发挥出策略，但这游戏明明可以很讲究策略，所以不利用一下有点浪费。

玩法简单，但因为物理碰撞效果，会造成很多有趣的玩法。这游戏证明了，瞬移不仅仅不会影响游戏性，甚至能够利用好瞬移创造出全新的游戏模式。

（注：现在单人模式改叫剧情模式了）

28248050.review:
First off, Paintball in Rec Room is probably my most-played multiplayer VR game.

Wait, what does that have to do with this game?  Well it basically reminds me a lot of that.  But because the teleportation system is a lot slower, and because you basically get one "bullet" per hand (and you can't teleport if your hands are full), it makes the game a lot more tactical than spamming shots at the enemy or just teleporting as fast as you can with the flag.

It also helps that the game will automatically fill spots with bots if necessary, something sorely missing from a lot of VR multiplayer games, and they're certainly competent enough in the solo mode, so there's less worry about not being able to play games later if the population falls down.

So yes, this may actually be my new favorite VR multiplayer game.

28243481.review:
Smashbox Arena is awesome! I jumped into the beta at the last minute and had the opportunity to play for a few hours with some of the devs and other testers, and I was not expecting what I found here. This game is a gem and is easily in my top 3 Vive games this year.

Many of the experiences I've had with other games felt short and unfinished; however Smashbox Arena is a fun, well-rounded multiplayer game that I know I will keep coming back to. As others have mentioned, It reminds me a lot like Rec Room paintball (my currently most-played game) and Unreal or Quake, and that's a good thing. The gameplay is fun, fast, and easy to jump into for a few minutes or a few hours. It takes a classic game like dodgeball and adds the multiplayer and powerup components of first-person shooters, creating a well designed virtual sport anyone can get into.

The maps are a good mixture of different-themed locales with interesting features that keep each game feeling fresh, requiring slightly different strategy depending on the environment. Each of the powerups have their pros and cons, depending on where you are, and the tie-breaker missile always gets everyone cheering (very reminiscent of the Redeemer in Unreal)! While the teams can become unbalanced occasionally, the game re-balances during map changes and does a good job of ensuring everyone has a fair chance. Seeing the trajectory of the shot that knocks you out is also a nice touch (I never question how I lost), and the god-mode spectator view is awesome (though a bit unwieldy to control). Overall, the quality of the game is excellent and you can tell that a lot of effort was put into its design and development.

While I ran into some minor bugs with the AI, a bit of lag, and some other minor technical glitches, none of those issues really impact the experience I have with this game and I'm confident that the developers care about their community and will continue working to improve Smashbox Arena further. I'm excited to continue playing, and would highly recommend Smashbox Arena to anyone looking for an addictive new virtual reality multiplayer game!

This game was really well done. Me and a friend got a chance to take part in the beta meet up. It plays really well, like a futuristic style dodgeball. Although the locomotion is teleportation, I really like how it's done in this game, especially for first person shooters. The ability to change your mind and "deek" out the enemy while teleporting is really cool. I also didn't feel any form of motion sickness and it was very easy to pick up with the few simple controls to use.

All the power ups seemed pretty awesome, 3 man boulder kill felt epic lol...! Smashbox keeps you constantly active with all the balls and specials floating around the map. It brought me back to the competitive memories with my buddies from childhood, playing Supersmash Bros. It's like VR + Supersmash + Dodgeball all came together to forge this glorious game!

28242339.review:
I have had the opportunity to play this game a few times between it's early development and it's release and it is one of the most enjoyable games i have played in a long time.

For me, the game feels like a blend of Dodgeball, Quake, and team games like Team Fortress.  I really like the ability to use your whole body to dodge, duck, etc.  It adds a great element to game play.  The developers have also done a great job balancing the maps, weapons, and match lengths to create a very engaging play experience.

Matches are fast paced and challenging (or a slaughter depending on who you are playing).  Like other games with respawns, you get back into the action fairly quickly since each "round" is time limited.  For me this keeps me engaged and motivated to want to keep playing more and more.  I am not usually one to get sucked in with FPS style games for long periods of time, but Smashbox Arena makes me want to play until i actually hurt (between jumping around my living room with my Vive on and bumping into things because I am overly focused on a match, it is a suprisingly physical activity).

I am really looking forward to seeing what new levels, features, weapons, and match styles the developers will be introducing post release.
